article.headline: Hokies end five-game losing streak
article.linkText: Matthews, Va. Tech upset No. 23 Providence
article.story: BLACKSBURG, Va. (AP) -- Bryant Matthews scored 23 points and Coleman Collins added 21 to help Virginia Tech beat No. 23 Providence 69-57 Wednesday night and snap a five-game losing streak. Tech (9-10, 2-6 Big East) withstood a late run by the Friars to beat a ranked team for the first time since topping No. 18 Connecticut 95-74 last Feb. 5. Providence (14-5, 5-3) was frustrated most of the game, committing 21 fouls and turning the ball over 19 times. Coach Tim Welsh slammed his jacket down with 1:15 left after complaining about trying to get a substitute in and receiving a technical foul. Ryan Gomes scored 18 points and Sheiku Kabba added 13 for Providence. Zabian Dowdell hit two straight 3-pointers in the second half to spark an 11-2 run. The Friars haven't won at Virginia Tech since a 75-60 victory on Jan. 20, 2001. Tech led 27-26 points at halftime. After trailing 10-8 in the first half, the Hokies went on a 12-2 run to open an eight-point lead. Collins scored 11 points in the first half. Bryan Randall, the quarterback on Tech's football team and a crowd favorite, drew cheers as he hit an open 3-pointer in the first half. Providence has lost two straight since winning six in a row. The Friars scored a season-low in points in a 55-46 loss Sunday at Seton Hall.
